intro: Hedyotis polycarpa, commonly known as the many-fruited gardenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows as a perennial herb or shrub, often found in moist, shaded environments. Hedyotis polycarpa is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
